Jeff, certainly link values at the min and max levels make sense since li=
nks can be pushed by evolution to the edges, where they will stay if that i=
s advantageous.

However, I do not know why there would be many zeros.  The=
re must be an implementation-specific reason for that that Jason may know.
=

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Jeff Clune <jclune@...> wrote:
>
> Hello=
 all-
> 
> I was just looking at some NEAT genomes and noticed that they ha=
ve many link
> values of exactly -3 (min), 3 (max), and 0.
> 
> Does NEAT h=
ave something that facilitates the production of max, min and 0?
> I know H=
yperNEAT facilitates the production of zeros...does NEAT?
> 
> PS. I am usi=
ng Jason's HyperNEAT C++ package, in case that is different in
> this respe=
ct.

g an
> analysis I am doing for an upcoming paper.
